Line 320: Line 320:
Former minister of the interior [[Habib Ibrahim El Adly|Habib El-Adli]] faces prosecution in a military court over giving orders to fire at protesters and obstructing peace in Egypt, as well as several other charges<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/02/07/us-egypt-adli-idUSTRE7163D420110207 |title=Egypt's ex-police chief appears before prosecutors |publisher=Reuters |date= |accessdate=2011-02-08}}</ref> Like his role in the New Year's Eve bombing of al-Qiddissin Church in Alexandria in which 24 people were killed and more than 90 were injured.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ikhwanweb.com/article.php?id=27982|title=Former Interior Minister Habib El Adly Accused of Being Involved in Alex Qiddisin's Church Bombings||publisher=Ikhwan Web|date=7 February 2011 |accessdate=8 February 2011}}</ref>
Former minister of the interior [[Habib Ibrahim El Adly|Habib El-Adli]] faces prosecution in a military court over giving orders to fire at protesters and obstructing peace in Egypt, as well as several other charges<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/02/07/us-egypt-adli-idUSTRE7163D420110207 |title=Egypt's ex-police chief appears before prosecutors |publisher=Reuters |date= |accessdate=2011-02-08}}</ref> Like his role in the New Year's Eve bombing of al-Qiddissin Church in Alexandria in which 24 people were killed and more than 90 were injured.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ikhwanweb.com/article.php?id=27982|title=Former Interior Minister Habib El Adly Accused of Being Involved in Alex Qiddisin's Church Bombings||publisher=Ikhwan Web|date=7 February 2011 |accessdate=8 February 2011}}</ref>
  +   +
Zahi Hawass, Egypt's minister of antiquities, announced that artifacts damaged by looters would be restored over the next five days<ref name="aljazlive"/>. He also said that steps were being taken to reopen Egypt's famed archaeological sites, which have been closed since pro-democracy protests started two weeks ago<ref name="aljazlive"/>. Among the objects damaged was a statue of King Tutankhamun standing on a panther and a wooden sarcophagus from the New Kingdom period, dating back roughly 3,500 years ago<ref name="aljazlive"/>. On January 28, looters broke into the museum and damaged a number of items, including two mummified skulls from the Late Period<ref name="aljazlive"/>. The museum, which is right next to the massive anti-government protests in downtown Cairo, is now being guarded by the army<ref name="aljazlive"/>.
70 or more people were wounded when residents in the hundreds attacked the police station in Khargah. Their demand was to oust the top police official who had a reputation for heavy-handedness. Police opened fire on the protesters.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110208/D9L8NDD03.html |title=Freed young leader energizes Egyptian protests |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-08}}</ref>
70 or more people were wounded when residents in the hundreds attacked the police station in Khargah. Their demand was to oust the top police official who had a reputation for heavy-handedness. Police opened fire on the protesters.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://apnews.myway.com//article/20110208/D9L8NDD03.html |title=Freed young leader energizes Egyptian protests |publisher=Apnews.myway.com |date= |accessdate=2011-02-08}}</ref>
